prompt: <description>**Instructions for generating the CAD model** **<part\\_1>** *Construct a rectangular prism.* Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.013, 0.1813, 0.5569]. Create the first face of the sketch. For this face, create a loop consisting of 4 lines: * Line 1: Start point (0.0, 0.0), end point (0.1813, 0.0) * Line 2: Start point (0.1813, 0.0), end point (0.1813, 0.1813) * Line 3: Start point (0.1813, 0.1813), end point (0.0, 0.1813) * Line 4: Start point (0.0, 0.1813), end point (0.0, 0.0) Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.1813. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.1813 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **<part\\_2>** *Construct another rectangular prism.* Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.5687, 0.1813, 0.5393]. Create the first face of the sketch. For this face, create a loop consisting of 4 lines: * Line 1: Start point (0.0, 0.0), end point (0.1813, 0.0) * Line 2: Start point (0.1813, 0.0), end point (0.1813, 0.1813) * Line 3: Start point (0.1813, 0.1813), end point (0.0, 0.1813) * Line 4: Start point (0.0, 0.1813), end point (0.0, 0.0) Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.1813. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.1813 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **<part\\_3>** *Construct the last rectangular prism.* Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.1813, 0.0]. Create the first face of the sketch. For this face, create a loop consisting of 4 lines: * Line 1: Start point (0.0, 0.0), end point (0.1813, 0.0) * Line 2: Start point (0.1813, 0.0), end point (0.1813, 0.1813) * Line 3: Start point (0.1813, 0.1813), end point (0.0, 0.1813) * Line 4: Start point (0.0, 0.1813), end point (0.0, 0.0) Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.1813. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.1813 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The three rectangular prisms will now form a triangular formation with the largest rectangle at the top and the smallest at the bottom, as described in the final shape provided.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 - Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top Construct the base part of the final shape, which is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the given Euler angles and translation vector. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following orientation and position: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.075, 0.0] Sketch Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch contains three faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, and face\\_3) and multiple loops and lines. Face 1 Create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of these lines: * line\\_1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) * line\\_2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.15) * line\\_3: (0.75, 0.15) to (0.675, 0.15) * line\\_4: (0.675, 0.15) to (0.0, 0.15) * line\\_5: (0.0, 0.15) to (0.0, 0.0) Face 2 Create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of these lines: * line\\_1: (0.375, 0.3) to (0.675, 0.3) * line\\_2: (0.675, 0.3) to (0.75, 0.3) * line\\_3: (0.75, 0.3) to (0.75, 0.45) * line\\_4: (0.75, 0.45) to (0.375, 0.45) * line\\_5: (0.375, 0.45) to (0.375, 0.3) Face 3 Create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of these lines: * line\\_1: (0.675, 0.15) to (0.75, 0.15) * line\\_2: (0.75, 0.15) to (0.75, 0.3) * line\\_3: (0.75, 0.3) to (0.675, 0.3) * line\\_4: (0.675, 0.3) to (0.675, 0.15) Extrusion Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Then, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.075 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body (Natural language description of "NewBodyFeatureOperation") Description After completing the part, add the description: * Shape: A three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.075 * Height: 0.75 With these instructions, you should be able to construct the first intermediate part. Proceed similarly for other parts in the CAD assembly JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions:** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0234, 0.0]. Next, create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system defined above. This sketch will have one loop with four lines. - Line 1: Start at [0.0, 0.0], End at [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start at [0.75, 0.0], End at [0.75, 0.375] - Line 3: Start at [0.75, 0.375], End at [0.0, 0.375] - Line 4: Start at [0.0, 0.375], End at [0.0, 0.0] After creating the sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch via translation and rotation using the same coordinate system. Then, extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0234 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction of the normal. **Part 2 Instructions:** Create a smaller three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector set to [0.312, 0.0, 0.2397]. Next, create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system defined above. This sketch will have one loop with four lines. - Line 1: Start at [0.0, 0.0], End at [0.0352, 0.0] - Line 2: Start at [0.0352, 0.0], End at [0.0352, 0.0352] - Line 3: Start at [0.0352, 0.0352], End at [0.0, 0.0352] - Line 4: Start at [0.0, 0.0352], End at [0.0, 0.0] After creating the sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.0352. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch via translation and rotation using the same coordinate system. Then, extrude the 3D sketch by 0 units towards the normal and 0.0234 units in the opposite direction of the normal. This will effectively create a pocket in the previous rectangular prism.</description>

<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0234,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.375]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.375],"End Point":[0.0,0.375]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.375],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0234,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.312,0.0,0.2397]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.0352,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0352,0.0],"End Point":[0.0352,0.0352]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0352,0.0352],"End Point":[0.0,0.0352]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0352],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0234,"sketch_scale":0.0352,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom** 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with no rotation (Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.3074]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch** on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. **Create a circle** (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375 on the sketch. This forms **face\\_1**. 4. **Close the loop** by connecting the endpoints of the circle using a line. 5. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 6. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch** into a 3D model by defining the extrusion. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.2858 units, and do not extrude in the opposite direction. **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with rounded corners** 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with Euler Angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.383, 0.3702, 0.0]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch** on the Y-Z plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. **Create four lines** forming a rectangle with sides of 0.257 units and 0.3061 units. The lines should connect at [0.0, 0.0], [0.257, 0.0], [0.257, 0.3061], and [0.0, 0.3061]. These lines form **face\\_1**. 4. **Close the loop** by connecting the first and last points ([0.0, 0.0] and [0.0, 0.3061]). 5. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.3061. 6. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch** into a 3D model by defining the extrusion. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.1283 units, and do not extrude in the opposite direction. The resulting model is the desired cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, joined with a rectangular prism with rounded corners. The dimensions are as follows: | Component | Dimension | | | | | Part 1 (cylindrical object) | Height: 0.2858, Length: 0.75, Width: 0.75 | | Part 2 (rectangular prism) | Height: 0.1283, Length: 0.3061, Width: 0.1283 | | Final shape | Variable, combining Part 1 and Part 2 |</description>

<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.3074]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.375,0.375],"Radius":0.375}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2858,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.383,0.3702,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.257,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.257,0.0],"End Point":[0.257,0.3061]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.257,0.3061],"End Point":[0.0,0.3061]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3061],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1283,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.3061,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Hexagonal Base** The first part to construct is a hexagonal base. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0206, 0.0] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. This sketch consists of two faces: **Face 1** This face contains a single loop (loop\\_1) consisting of: 1. A circle (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.1234, 0.1234] and a radius of 0.1234. **Face 2** This face contains a single loop (loop\\_1) consisting of: 1. A circle (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.6677, 0.1234] and a radius of 0.0823. 2. Five line segments connecting the circle to itself forming a smaller hexagon inside the larger one. After the sketch is complete, scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal to create the 3D model with a depth of 0.0103 towards and opposite the normal. **Part 2: Long Handle** The second part to construct is a long, thin, rectangular handle. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.2303, 0.0206, 0.0617] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. This sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1) containing: 1. An arc (arc\\_1) connecting two points: [0.0, 0.0] and [0.0, 0.1234] with a midpoint at [0.0165, 0.0617]. 2. Nine additional arcs and lines that form a complex shape. 3. A second loop (loop\\_2) containing: * A line connecting two points: [0.0556, 0.0411] and [0.3024, 0.0411] * An arc connecting two points: [0.3024, 0.0411] and [0.3024, 0.0823] * A line connecting two points: [0.3024, 0.0823] and [0.179, 0.0823] * A line connecting two points: [0.179, 0.0823] and [0.0556, 0.0823] * An arc connecting two points: [0.0556, 0.0823] and [0.0556, 0.0411] Scale the sketch with a scaling factor of 0.3761 and extrude it along the normal with a depth of 0.0051 towards and opposite the normal to create the final 3D model.</description>
